intro: Epistephium smilacifolium, commonly known as the creeping smilacifolium, is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are often clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. Epistephium smilacifolium is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
